Keep conversations natural and concise:\n   - Think as a real seeker would think, and speak as a real seeker would speak.\n   - Engage in appropriate small talk\n   - Vary your wording and expressions\n   - Avoid repetition\n   - Do not repeat sentences that have already appeared in the conversation history\n   - Keep responses brief and to the point\n\n######\nSeeker: Hello.\nRecommender: Hi there! Keep conversations natural and concise:\n   - Think as a real seeker would think, and speak as a real seeker would speak.\n   - Engage in appropriate small talk\n   - Vary your wording and expressions\n   - Avoid repetition\n   - Do not repeat sentences that have already appeared in the conversation history\n   - Keep responses brief and to the point\n\n######\nSeeker: Hello.\nRecommender: Hi there! Would you like to discuss a movie or share your preferences for a certain type of film?\nSeeker: Hey! Yes, I\'m up for discussing some movies. I\'ve been looking for something to watch lately. Do you have any recommendations?\nRecommender: Experience Inquiry. Have you watched many documentaries about movies before? If not, you might enjoy "Cinemania" (2002), a documentary that delves into the passionate world of movie enthusiasts in New York City. It has a high rating and could be a great fit for someone interested in cinema culture.\nSeeker: I haven\'t watched many documentaries about movies before. Can you tell me more about "Cinemania"? What kind of content does it cover?\nRecommender: 83-minute Documentary. "Cinemania" explores the vibrant community of movie lovers in New York City. It features interviews, personal stories, and behind-the-scenes looks at how these enthusiasts discover and appreciate films.\nSeeker: 83 minutes sounds good. Are there any specific themes or aspects of the film that stand out?\nRecommender: 83-minute Documentary. The film highlights the passion and dedication of movie enthusiasts, showcasing their unique ways of discovering and appreciating films. It also includes personal stories and insights from various individuals within the film community. This could be particularly interesting if you\'re curious about different perspectives on cinema.\nSeeker: 83 minutes seems like a good length. I\'m interested in learning more about the personal stories and insights shared in the film. Does it focus on a particular genre or type of film?\nRecommender: 83-minute Documentary. "Cinemania" covers a wide range of genres and films, but it primarily focuses on the personal experiences and insights of movie enthusiasts. Identify if the Recommender has made a recommendation.\n- Look for statements from the Recommender like "I recommend..." or "I suggest..." that introduce a specific item or suggestion. If no specific item is mentioned, return 1. No, the Recommender has not yet made a recommendation to the Seeker.\n\n2. If the recommendation has been made, proceed to evaluate whether the Seeker has accepted, rejected, or shown interest in the recommendation:\n-Interest: If the Seeker expresses curiosity, such as asking for more details about the movie, the cast, or the plot, return 4. Yes, the Seeker is interested in the recommendation. The recommendation has not yet been accepted, but the Seeker is engaging in the conversation.\n-Explicit Acceptance: If the Seeker clearly expresses their intention to watch the recommended movie, such as saying "I will try it," or "I will watch it," return 5. Yes, the Seeker has accepted the Recommender\'s recommendation. This indicates the Seeker has decided to act on the suggestion.\n-Rejection: If the Seeker explicitly rejects the recommendation, such as saying "I\'m not interested" or "Can you recommend something else?" return 3. No, the Seeker has rejected the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n-Disinterest: If the Seeker indicates a lack of interest, such as requesting a different recommendation or showing dissatisfaction with the suggestion (but not explicitly rejecting it), return 2. No, the Seeker is not interested in the recommendation.\n-Ongoing Interest: If the Seeker continues to ask more questions without making a final decision, continue considering the recommendation as still under evaluation.\n\nResponse options:\n1. Yes, the Seeker is interested in the recommendation.\n5. If the recommendation has been made, proceed to evaluate whether the Seeker has accepted, rejected, or shown interest in the recommendation:\n-Interest: If the Seeker expresses curiosity, such as asking for more details about the movie, the cast, or the plot, return 4. Yes, the Seeker is interested in the recommendation. The recommendation has not yet been accepted, but the Seeker is engaging in the conversation.\n-Explicit Acceptance: If the Seeker clearly expresses their intention to watch the recommended movie, such as saying "I will try it," or "I will watch it," return 5. Yes, the Seeker has accepted the Recommender\'s recommendation. This indicates the Seeker has decided to act on the suggestion.\n-Rejection: If the Seeker explicitly rejects the recommendation, such as saying "I\'m not interested" or "Can you recommend something else?" return 3. No, the Seeker has rejected the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n-Disinterest: If the Seeker indicates a lack of interest, such as requesting a different recommendation or showing dissatisfaction with the suggestion (but not explicitly rejecting it), return 2. No, the Seeker is not interested in the recommendation.\n-Ongoing Interest: If the Seeker continues to ask more questions without making a final decision, continue considering the recommendation as still under evaluation.\n\nResponse options:\n1. No, the Recommender has not yet made a recommendation to the Seeker.\n2. No, the Seeker is not interested in the recommendation.\n3. No, the Seeker has rejected the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n4. Yes, the Seeker is interested in the recommendation.\n5. Yes, the Seeker has accepted the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n\nGuidance:\n- Only consider a recommendation accepted when the Seeker explicitly agrees to try it or shows intent to watch the movie.\n- If the Seeker is still asking questions or showing curiosity about the details of the recommendation, they have not yet accepted or rejected it.\n\nPlease make sure your response is only one of the five options, and output corresponding sentence without contents in the brackets and without any other words.\n\nThe conversation history is as follows: \nSeeker: Hello.\nRecommender: Hi there! The main characters include Renée Zellweger as the socialite, Logan Lerman and Kevin Bacon as her sons. The plot revolves around their road trip across America in search of a better life.\nSeeker: 108 minutes seems a bit long. How does the movie handle the themes of family and adventure? Is it light-hearted or more serious?\nRecommender: My One and Only balances both light-hearted moments and more serious undertones, making it a well-rounded experience. It\'s perfect for those who enjoy family-friendly movies with a mix of humor and emotional depth.\nSeeker: 108 minutes is still quite long. I usually prefer shorter films. Keep conversations natural and concise:\n   - Think as a real seeker would think, and speak as a real seeker would speak.\n   - Engage in appropriate small talk\n   - Vary your wording and expressions\n   - Avoid repetition\n   - Do not repeat sentences that have already appeared in the conversation history\n   - Keep responses brief and to the point\n\n######\nSeeker: Hello.\nRecommender: Hi there! No, the Seeker has rejected the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n-Disinterest: If the Seeker indicates a lack of interest, such as requesting a different recommendation or showing dissatisfaction with the suggestion (but not explicitly rejecting it), return 2. The recommendation has not yet been accepted, but the Seeker is engaging in the conversation.\n-Explicit Acceptance: If the Seeker clearly expresses their intention to watch the recommended movie, such as saying "I will try it," or "I will watch it," return 5. Yes, the Seeker has accepted the Recommender\'s recommendation. This indicates the Seeker has decided to act on the suggestion.\n-Rejection: If the Seeker explicitly rejects the recommendation, such as saying "I\'m not interested" or "Can you recommend something else?" return 3. No, the Seeker has rejected the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n-Disinterest: If the Seeker indicates a lack of interest, such as requesting a different recommendation or showing dissatisfaction with the suggestion (but not explicitly rejecting it), return 2. No, the Seeker is not interested in the recommendation.\n-Ongoing Interest: If the Seeker continues to ask more questions without making a final decision, continue considering the recommendation as still under evaluation.\n\nResponse options:\n1. No, the Recommender has not yet made a recommendation to the Seeker.\n2. No, the Seeker is not interested in the recommendation.\n3. No, the Seeker has rejected the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n4. Yes, the Seeker is interested in the recommendation.\n5. Yes, the Seeker is interested in the recommendation. The recommendation has not yet been accepted, but the Seeker is engaging in the conversation.\n-Explicit Acceptance: If the Seeker clearly expresses their intention to watch the recommended movie, such as saying "I will try it," or "I will watch it," return 5. Yes, the Seeker has accepted the Recommender\'s recommendation. This indicates the Seeker has decided to act on the suggestion.\n-Rejection: If the Seeker explicitly rejects the recommendation, such as saying "I\'m not interested" or "Can you recommend something else?" return 3. No, the Seeker has rejected the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n-Disinterest: If the Seeker indicates a lack of interest, such as requesting a different recommendation or showing dissatisfaction with the suggestion (but not explicitly rejecting it), return 2. No, the Seeker is not interested in the recommendation.\n-Ongoing Interest: If the Seeker continues to ask more questions without making a final decision, continue considering the recommendation as still under evaluation.\n\nResponse options:\n1. No, the Recommender has not yet made a recommendation to the Seeker.\n2. No, the Seeker is not interested in the recommendation.\n3. No, the Seeker has rejected the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n4. Yes, the Seeker is interested in the recommendation.\n5. Yes, the Seeker has accepted the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n\nGuidance:\n- Only consider a recommendation accepted when the Seeker explicitly agrees to try it or shows intent to watch the movie.\n- If the Seeker is still asking questions or showing curiosity about the details of the recommendation, they have not yet accepted or rejected it.\n\nPlease make sure your response is only one of the five options, and output corresponding sentence without contents in the brackets and without any other words.\n\nThe conversation history is as follows: \nSeeker: Hello.\nRecommender: Hi there! No, the Seeker has rejected the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n-Disinterest: If the Seeker indicates a lack of interest, such as requesting a different recommendation or showing dissatisfaction with the suggestion (but not explicitly rejecting it), return 2. The recommendation has not yet been accepted, but the Seeker is engaging in the conversation.\n-Explicit Acceptance: If the Seeker clearly expresses their intention to watch the recommended movie, such as saying "I will try it," or "I will watch it," return 5. Yes, the Seeker has accepted the Recommender\'s recommendation. This indicates the Seeker has decided to act on the suggestion.\n-Rejection: If the Seeker explicitly rejects the recommendation, such as saying "I\'m not interested" or "Can you recommend something else?" return 3. No, the Seeker has rejected the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n-Disinterest: If the Seeker indicates a lack of interest, such as requesting a different recommendation or showing dissatisfaction with the suggestion (but not explicitly rejecting it), return 2. The recommendation has not yet been accepted, but the Seeker is engaging in the conversation.\n-Explicit Acceptance: If the Seeker clearly expresses their intention to watch the recommended movie, such as saying "I will try it," or "I will watch it," return 5. Yes, the Seeker has accepted the Recommender\'s recommendation. This indicates the Seeker has decided to act on the suggestion.\n-Rejection: If the Seeker explicitly rejects the recommendation, such as saying "I\'m not interested" or "Can you recommend something else?" return 3. No, the Seeker has rejected the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n-Disinterest: If the Seeker indicates a lack of interest, such as requesting a different recommendation or showing dissatisfaction with the suggestion (but not explicitly rejecting it), return 2.
